sentences.sContent: People say the judge had been bought by the Mafia.
sentences.sCn: 人们都说法官被黑手党收买了。

sentences.sContent: ...This boosts the local economy considerably because tourists not only buy crafts...
...ready to buy ice-cream; they remember when they were kids and they saw a truck...
...and in most places you can't buy alcohol at drive-through facilities...
...Now you buy milk and other products in plastic bottles or paper containers...
...Companies are also trying to get customers to buy new and more items...
...We should buy a good guide book and study it before our trip to Vancouver...
...We’d like to buy a good flight as cheaply as possible...
...people should buy fresh food and cook it themselves...

trans.tranOther: to pay money to someone, especially someone in a position of authority, in order to persuade them to do something dishonest
